Package se.arkalix.security

Class X509ArrowheadName

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.arkalix.security.X509ArrowheadName
  • public class X509ArrowheadName
extends java.lang.Object
    Describes an Arrowhead system, operator, cloud or company certificate.

    As the name of this class implies, the data it contains are assumed to originate from x.509 certificates used to represent Arrowhead entities.

    An x.509 Arrowhead name describes a certificate owned by either an Arrowhead system, operator, cloud or company, depending on which of these fields are present in the descriptor. If only a company and master name is part of the descriptor, it describes a company certificate, as follows: 

         company-inc.arrowhead.eu
     |_________| |__________|
          |           |
       Company      Master
    If a cloud name, company name and master name is present, it describes a cloud, as follows: 
         cloud24.company-inc.arrowhead.eu
     |_____| |_________| |__________|
        |         |           |
      Cloud    Company      Master
    And, lastly, if all names are present, it describes either a system or an operator, as follows: 
         system3.cloud24.company-inc.arrowhead.eu
     |_____| |_____| |_________| |__________|
        |       |         |           |
     System   Cloud    Company      Master
    See Also:
    X509Certificates.subjectArrowheadNameOf(X509Certificate)

    • Method Detail

      • valueOf

        public static X509ArrowheadName valueOf​(java.lang.String name)
        Attempts to produce certificate descriptor form provided name.

        The master part of the name must be "arrowhead.eu", as it otherwise would be impossible to tell where the master part begins. The reason for this is that the parts of a certificate descriptor are separated by dots, and the only way of telling them apart is by counting the dots. As the master part is allowed to contain any number of dots, the number of dots in the master part must be known in order for the other parts to be identifiable.

        Parameters:
        name - Certificate LDAP DN to parse.
        Returns:
        Certificate descriptor.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If provided name is not a valid certificate descriptor.

      • system

        public java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> system()
        Returns:
        Name of system represented by the described certificate, if any.

      • cloud

        public java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> cloud()

      • master

        public java.lang.String master()
        Returns:
        Name of master certificate.
